intro: Valeriana dorotheae, commonly known as Dorothea valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Valeriana dorotheae is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in traditional medicine.
